title: Paris Fashion Week 2019: From Cardi B's floral-faced look to Helen Mirren's barefoot runway moment
text:
Fashion month has officially ended with a floral-print bang thanks to Cardi B.

The Bronx-raised rapper showed up to Paris Fashion Week in head-to-toe florals.

On Instagram, she released a video strolling in front of the Eiffel Tower with a matching green and blue floral-print headscarf, belted blazer, skirt, stockings and her face fully covered.

In the video, she instructs onlookers to make sure a car doesn't hit her because she couldn't see.

Since posting, Cardi B's video immediately went viral, and fans couldn't get enough.

One person left a comment under Cardi B's video saying, "Okay, I'm shooketh" while another joked mentioning, "Looking like a wallpaper and granny's couch."

In addition to Cardi B's eye-catching video, iconic model Dame Helen Mirren also gave Paris Fashion Week a moment to remember.

The 74-year-old notable brought smiles to many people's faces when she jubilantly ran out on to the runway for L'Oréal's Le Défilé show.

Bertrand Rindoff Petroff/Getty Images

During this exciting moment, Mirren wore a flowy black and white Giambattista Valli dress that she held up with a smile.

She posted the moment on Instagram saying, "Take off! Such a grand time on the runway in Paris with my L’Oreal family. I had a blast with all the girls and boys and men and women," she continued.

Helen Mirren • L'Oreal Paris Le Défilé pic.twitter.com/xjD3pLy5aJ — artlessgypsy (@opiumclaro) September 28, 2019

Other familiar faces on L'Oréal's runway included actress Eva Longoria and singer Camila Cabello.
description: From Cardi's floral-faced look to Helen Mirren's barefoot runway moment, Paris Fashion Week 2019 delivered.
